result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandan Sean Jolliff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 14CM378 & 15CM174 called together at 8:54 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Brandan S Jolliff in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing Arguments by Counsel

On Count #1-14CM378 & On Count #3-15CM174, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 4 days in Jefferson County Jail, (on 15CM174) with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence 10/29/15 at 6:00 pm 
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--Take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges
--To pay DNA Surcharge
 on each count
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
 (15CM174)
--To pay $33 subpoena fees (14CM378)
--No acts/threats of violence

Days credit for time already served: 0 day
-14CM378
Days credit for time already served: 1 day-15CM174
Recess: 9:05 am
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Cases 14CM378 & 15CM174 called together at 9:00 am [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Brandan S Jolliff in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1-14CM378 & Count #3-15CM174; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2-14CM378 & Counts #1 & #2-15CM174
Court continues bond as previously set
Recess: 9:33 am 

NEXT: Schedule Sentencing Hearing 10/15/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices

Cases 14CM378 and 15CM174 called together at 9:35am [mo]
Defendant Brandan S Jolliff in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CM174(Adjourned Initial Appearance occurs):

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $1000  signature bond, with conditions: 
--not to consume any alcohol
--no to possess any alcohol except for work purposes
--no acts or threats of violence
 toward any person
--no presence in bars, tavern, or liquor stores, except for work purposes
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

recess
: 9:45am 


NEXT:  As to both cases: (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/26/15 at 9:00am    (2)  Status Conference on 9/11/15 at 9:00am
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[Reserve Judge Sarah OBrien presiding for Branch IV]
Case called at 10:00am [mo]
Defendant Brandan Sean Jolliff in court.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth. Mr. Jolliff indicates that he now has a Clyman St, Watertown address.
Right to Counsel given; Mr. Jolliff indicates that he wishes to have counsel. The Court will postpone hearing to allow Mr. Jolliff to obtain counsel.
The Court instructs Mr. Jolliff to go to the Jefferson PD office and return and inform the Court whether or not he qualifies for PD representation; further the Court instructs Mr. Jolliff to apply for Court Appointed Counsel is if he does not qualify for PD representation. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.
The Court does not set bond at this time. 
recess: 10:03am


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance: 8/7/15 at 9:30am

[Clerk's Note: At end of morning session (11:45am) the Court directs the Clerk to make a note in the record that Mr. Jolliff had not yet returned from the PD office to inform the Court of the determination of eligibility]
